p: At least 37 mosquito species belonging to eight genera were collected. The genus Aedes recorded the highest number of species (14 species) closely followed by Culex (12 species). The other genera ( Eretmapodites, Coquillettidia, Uranotaenia, Lutzia and Anopheles) recorded less than four species each ( Table 1). Out of the 37 species, Ae. africanus were the most abundant ( n = 1023, 36.6%), followed by Cx. duttoni ( n = 510, 19.25%), Cx. moucheti ( n = 242, 9.13%), Cx. (Culiciomyia) spp. ( n = 218, 8.23%), Ae. albopictus ( n = 192, 7.25%) and individuals of the Cx. pipiens complex ( n = 174, 6.57%) ( Table 1).
